result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Walters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharges, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC, during period of probation or civil judgment.
*Restitution is set at zero.
*NO firearms; weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

*NO drugs.
*NO alcohol.
*NO alcohol or drugs without prescription.
*NO contact with victim, Lacheryl B., without approval of the court.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue  programming. 
*Go to room 511 and sign up for BIP today.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment  deemed appropriate.

*Participate in AODA and successfully complete recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
07-15-2016/ Judge Michelle Havaas
The defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defedant taken into custody to spend 90 days, RETRO to 06-14-2016, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC. 

*Stayed pending review on 10/09/15 at 1:30pm, BR. 38.
*10/9/2015  Honorable Jeffrey A. Wagner-STAYED until the termination of probation or for future use at the agent's discretion.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Walters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: reflects 07-15-2016 Court order imposing 90 days of condition time (retro to 06-14-16).

Defendant Randall Walters in court, in custody.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 90 days of the condition time retro to 6-14-2016; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Case scheduled for Probation Review Hearing.  Agent in court.  Defendant needs to have a Public Defender appointed.  Clerk notified PD office of next court date.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 7-15-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
Per probation Agent, a review is schedule for 07/06/2016 at 01:30 pm, Branch 45. LNR

Defendant came in and completed a yellow card (Request for Bail Forfeiture Hearing) this date.
Card was not returned within 30 days and bail was forfeited.  No hearing has been scheduled.

Defendant Randall Walters in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Memorandum received and filed.  Probation agent present in court.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered the time in the House of Correction, previously ordered and STAYED  for review on today's date, be STAYED until the termination of probation or for future use at the agent's discretion.
No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($300.00) ad

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case 2014CM3876, dismissed and read-in to case 2015CM312 for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #1 and #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Lacheryl B.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 34 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
   No alcohol or drugs without prescription.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Lacheryl B., 
   without approval of the court.    
* Obtain and maintain employment. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Today, go to Room 511 and sign u for BIP today.  
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 10-9-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.
Defense motion for GPS release to attend a funeral heard.  Court granted the request.  Defendant may attend the funeral at 1557 N 29th St from 11:00 am to 2:00 pm on 7/10/15.  Case remains set on 7/16/15 in Branch 4.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
for Modification of Bond received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm
The Court ordered that defendant is allowed GPS release for ONE job and location PER day, if verified by Justice Point in advance.   mld

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Conditions of GPS release is heard and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-16-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Mark Dluzak for attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Conditions of GPS Release is heard and denied by the Court.  The Court would require more detailed particulars (ie. addresses for employers), regarding release privileges for work.  Case remains calendared for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-27-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court ordered that the defendant is granted gps release for ONE visit to Community Advocates in regards to electric bill.  Justice Point must be advised of where and how long the appointment will be at Community Advocates.   mld

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court heard and granted defense Motion to Modify GPS Supervision to allow the defendant one visit to the Community Advocates regarding his electric bill.  Justice Point must be advised of where and how long the appointment will be at Community Advocates.  

Court advised by defense, that the victim no longer resides at the address of 4665 W Medford Avenue, Milwaukee.  Estelle, Victim Witness Services Unit will contact the victim, to advice of her current location.  Brief break.

Back on the record.  Same parties.  Telephone call placed to the victim by the Victim Witness Services Unit, confirmed that she does not reside at the address of 4665 W Medford Avenue, Milwaukee.  Upon the request of defense counsel, with no objection by the State, Court ordered that the address of 4665 W. Medford Avenue, is removed from the no contact order as a condition of bail.  

New defense counsel will need to obtain discovery from prior counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-27-2015 at 8:30 am.    mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.    mld

Pretrial electronic monitoring (GPS) program order for supervision with the following conditions signed and filed:
-Drug testing
-Breathalyzer tests
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription
-No contact with Lachery B. and McKayla W. and 4665 W. Medford Avenue
-Absolutely no release from home except for: medical/dental appointments (verified), Legal and one trip to his bank - one hour or less

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Randall Walters in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Matter scheduled for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Justice Point, received and filed.  mld

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Randall Walters not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Defense counsel was unaware of the Bail / Bond Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 for today's date.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case remains calendared for Defense Motion to Withdraw Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Defendant was taken into custody.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Randall Walters in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned for return on bail review hearing in Branch 04, Judge Flanagan.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.   
-- Breathalyzer Test - Positive.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Email received from Nicole Pritzlaff, from Justice Point, that the defendant had a positive breathalyzer test, today's date.  Clerk instructed Justice Point to have the defendant report directly to the Court.  The Court was instructed by Justice Point, that the defendant vacated the building, despite being instructed to remain in the office.   Defendant failing to comply with conditions of bail, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.  The Court vacates the Motion Hearing date of 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm and ordered case set for Calendar Call on 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 4.   mld

to Withdraw as Counsel from Attorney Brian Hagner, received and filed.  
-- Motion Hearing Scheduled for 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Fax received from Phil Haddix, addressed to the Court regarding Randall Walters, received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel.   mld

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm.  

Court granted the motion of Defense with no objection by the State, that defendant is allowed to move back to the residence where the incident took place, (4665 W. Medford Avenue, Milwaukee).  All other conditions of bail are continued, including cooperation with Justice Point GPS Supervision, Absolute Sobriety and No Contact with Lacheryl B., until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
addressed to the court from Phil Haddix, School Social Worker, Riverside University High School (retired), received and filed.   mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- GPS Violation: 2-17-2015.   mld

15RM008203  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-14-2015
Defendant to have no contact with Lacheryl B., or the address of 4665 W. Medford, Milwaukee, WI.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Release for medical / dental appointments, legal contacts and court.

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery received by defense counsel.  Global offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  

Statement made by victim, Lacheryl B.  

Motion of the State to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $300.00 on both cases 2014CM3876 and 2015CM312, with gps supervision.

Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 3-10-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LACHERYL B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Randall Walters in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
